
Intercepted message uses RSA, but the modulus is a Blum integer. Can you exploit its properties to decrypt the secret? Ciphertext: 2803114883779921101893847449701590700488167898184863776593006465210112219394680566548098460955204921203347190059882786888565536967501029788054112873002366

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{y2v4ydp8}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2803114883779921101893847449701590700488167898184863776593006465210112219394680566548098460955204921203347190059882786888565536967501029788054112873002366
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5994659131535892341050230408875078471530700588859754388931088102163728882284879051694699517251548601332058283754901389999146345615745243845414802796128337, e=4898607420172873603982754969278176869446200189222515996099709718647111821810032708927456105576171769443319236700529665126510375180593933676093111963761615
The lower 104 bits of p are: 62276325628273476182713612612817115003

extra_info: p=66808767980229816519350031125894434766608950091589152629266562465008341211003, q=89728628633143538773152957936966106554300193062704182120588878833345027919779, Ï†(n)=5994659131535892341050230408875078471530700588859754388931088102163728882284722514298086143896256098342995423213580480855992052280995388404116449426997556
